title.rendered: Former porn actress Lana Rhoades is charged with alleged fraud

content.rendered:
The former adult film star had started a project with NFTs (non-fungible tokens) in which his followers would have numerous benefits, but none of this came to pass.

Former adult film actress Lana Rhoades is accused by her followers for allegedly scam with NFTs (non-fungible tokens) for an amount amounting to 1.8 million dollars.

It all started with the project of the 24-year-old girl: CryptoSis. A collection of digital art that also benefited buyers.

Those who bought her NFTs would access a private chat with her. It was an experience Ask me Anything (ask me anything) via Discord.

In addition, they would be participating in a trip to South Africa to meet Rhoades personally.

The resounding success of CryptoSis was reflected in Lana Rhoades’ NFT account, which reached 50,000 subscribers in 48 hours. Likewise, the sale of the tokens raised $1.8 million.

Nevertheless, rhoades disappeared after the NFT reached the sky-high value. What’s more, all the promotion he did on social media was removed, including the TikTok account.

In this way, the price of $1,500 the cost of your NFT plummeted to the 15 dollarsbecoming a Rug Pull (“rug pull”, a type of scam in the world of cryptocurrencies).

The “explanation” that Lana Rhoades gave, so as not to raise suspicions of fraud, is that would have disappeared for rude comments that you received on Discord. Thus assured the porn star, Mia Malkova and that Infobae confirmed.

The former member of adult cinema has not spoken about the subject on social networks again. It is also unknown what will happen to the money of the followers who invested in the NFT.
